description.narrative: Setting up a network of regional and central governments' institutions acting for conflict management and prevention; and building political concensus for the continuity --beyond the incoming elections-- of the conflict management regional units created in former phases of the project./ Cajamarca (Northern Andes); San Martin (North Western Amazonia); Arequipa and Junin (Southern and Central Andes). This proposal seeks to consolidate the achievements of two successful former projects aiming at building capacities inside the Regional Governments, allowing that conflicts be detected and managed at local level, before they grow critical. There is a growing demand for specialized capacity on the matter, but the number of experts is still short and concentrated in the capital city, while conflicts tend to emerge inside the country and most frequently in the Andean regions.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
